speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: SCENE II. Another part of the island.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Enter CALIBAN with a burden of wood. A noise of thunder heard

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: All the infections that the sun sucks up

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: From bogs, fens, flats, on Prosper fall and make him

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: By inch-meal a disease! His spirits hear me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And yet I needs must curse. But they'll nor pinch,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Fright me with urchin--shows, pitch me i' the mire,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Nor lead me, like a firebrand, in the dark

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Out of my way, unless he bid 'em; but

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For every trifle are they set upon me;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Sometime like apes that mow and chatter at me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And after bite me, then like hedgehogs which

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Lie tumbling in my barefoot way and mount

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Their pricks at my footfall; sometime am I

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: All wound with adders who with cloven tongues

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do hiss me into madness.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Enter TRINCULO

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Lo, now, lo!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Here comes a spirit of his, and to torment me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For bringing wood in slowly. I'll fall flat;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Perchance he will not mind me.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Here's neither bush nor shrub, to bear off

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: any weather at all, and another storm brewing;

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I hear it sing i' the wind: yond same black

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: cloud, yond huge one, looks like a foul

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: bombard that would shed his liquor. If it

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: should thunder as it did before, I know not

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: where to hide my head: yond same cloud cannot

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: choose but fall by pailfuls. What have we

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: here? a man or a fish? dead or alive? A fish:

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: he smells like a fish; a very ancient and fish-

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: like smell; a kind of not of the newest Poor-

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: John. A strange fish! Were I in England now,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: as once I was, and had but this fish painted,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: not a holiday fool there but would give a piece

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: of silver: there would this monster make a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: man; any strange beast there makes a man:

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: when they will not give a doit to relieve a lame

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: beggar, they will lazy out ten to see a dead

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Indian. Legged like a man and his fins like

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: arms! Warm o' my troth! I do now let loose

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: my opinion; hold it no longer: this is no fish,

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: but an islander, that hath lately suffered by a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: thunderbolt.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Thunder

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Alas, the storm is come again! my best way is to

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: creep under his gaberdine; there is no other

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: shelter hereabouts: misery acquaints a man with

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: strange bed-fellows. I will here shroud till the

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: dregs of the storm be past.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Enter STEPHANO, singing: a bottle in his hand

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I shall no more to sea, to sea,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Here shall I die ashore--

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This is a very scurvy tune to sing at a man's

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: funeral: well, here's my comfort.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Drinks

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Sings

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: The master, the swabber, the boatswain and I,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: The gunner and his mate

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Loved Mall, Meg and Marian and Margery,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: But none of us cared for Kate;

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: For she had a tongue with a tang,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Would cry to a sailor, Go hang!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: She loved not the savour of tar nor of pitch,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Yet a tailor might scratch her where'er she did itch:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Then to sea, boys, and let her go hang!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This is a scurvy tune too: but here's my comfort.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Drinks

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do not torment me: Oh!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: What's the matter? Have we devils here? Do you put

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: tricks upon's with savages and men of Ind, ha? I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: have not scaped drowning to be afeard now of your

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: four legs; for it hath been said, As proper a man as

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: ever went on four legs cannot make him give ground;

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and it shall be said so again while Stephano

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: breathes at's nostrils.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The spirit torments me; Oh!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: This is some monster of the isle with four legs, who

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: hath got, as I take it, an ague. Where the devil

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: should he learn our language? I will give him some

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: relief, if it be but for that. if I can recover him

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and keep him tame and get to Naples with him, he's a

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: present for any emperor that ever trod on neat's leather.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Do not torment me, prithee; I'll bring my wood home faster.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: He's in his fit now and does not talk after the

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: wisest. He shall taste of my bottle: if he have

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: never drunk wine afore will go near to remove his

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: fit. If I can recover him and keep him tame, I will

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: not take too much for him; he shall pay for him that

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: hath him, and that soundly.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou dost me yet but little hurt; thou wilt anon, I

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: know it by thy trembling: now Prosper works upon thee.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come on your ways; open your mouth; here is that

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: which will give language to you, cat: open your

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: mouth; this will shake your shaking, I can tell you,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and that soundly: you cannot tell who's your friend:

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: open your chaps again.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I should know that voice: it should be--but he is

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: drowned; and these are devils: O defend me!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Four legs and two voices: a most delicate monster!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: His forward voice now is to speak well of his

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: friend; his backward voice is to utter foul speeches

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and to detract. If all the wine in my bottle will

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: recover him, I will help his ague. Come. Amen! I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: will pour some in thy other mouth.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Stephano!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Doth thy other mouth call me? Mercy, mercy! This is

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: a devil, and no monster: I will leave him; I have no

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: long spoon.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Stephano! If thou beest Stephano, touch me and

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: speak to me: for I am Trinculo--be not afeard--thy

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: good friend Trinculo.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: If thou beest Trinculo, come forth: I'll pull thee

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: by the lesser legs: if any be Trinculo's legs,

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: these are they. Thou art very Trinculo indeed! How

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: camest thou to be the siege of this moon-calf? can

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: he vent Trinculos?

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I took him to be killed with a thunder-stroke. But

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: art thou not drowned, Stephano? I hope now thou art

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: not drowned. Is the storm overblown? I hid me

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: under the dead moon-calf's gaberdine for fear of

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: the storm. And art thou living, Stephano? O

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Stephano, two Neapolitans 'scaped!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Prithee, do not turn me about; my stomach is not constant.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: [Aside]  These be fine things, an if they be

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: not sprites.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: That's a brave god and bears celestial liquor.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I will kneel to him.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: How didst thou 'scape? How camest thou hither?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: swear by this bottle how thou camest hither. I

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: escaped upon a butt of sack which the sailors

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: heaved o'erboard, by this bottle; which I made of

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: the bark of a tree with mine own hands since I was

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: cast ashore.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll swear upon that bottle to be thy true subject;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: for the liquor is not earthly.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Here; swear then how thou escapedst.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Swum ashore. man, like a duck: I can swim like a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: duck, I'll be sworn.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Here, kiss the book. Though thou canst swim like a

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: duck, thou art made like a goose.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: O Stephano. hast any more of this?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: The whole butt, man: my cellar is in a rock by the

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: sea-side where my wine is hid. How now, moon-calf!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: how does thine ague?

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Hast thou not dropp'd from heaven?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Out o' the moon, I do assure thee: I was the man i'

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: the moon when time was.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I have seen thee in her and I do adore thee:

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: My mistress show'd me thee and thy dog and thy bush.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come, swear to that; kiss the book: I will furnish

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: it anon with new contents swear.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: By this good light, this is a very shallow monster!

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I afeard of him! A very weak monster! The man i'

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: the moon! A most poor credulous monster! Well

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: drawn, monster, in good sooth!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll show thee every fertile inch o' th' island;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And I will kiss thy foot: I prithee, be my god.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: By this light, a most perfidious and drunken

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: monster! when 's god's asleep, he'll rob his bottle.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll kiss thy foot; I'll swear myself thy subject.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come on then; down, and swear.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: I shall laugh myself to death at this puppy-headed

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: monster. A most scurvy monster! I could find in my

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: heart to beat him,--

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Come, kiss.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: But that the poor monster's in drink: an abominable monster!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll show thee the best springs; I'll pluck thee berries;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll fish for thee and get thee wood enough.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: A plague upon the tyrant that I serve!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I'll bear him no more sticks, but follow thee,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou wondrous man.

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: A most ridiculous monster, to make a wonder of a

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: Poor drunkard!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I prithee, let me bring thee where crabs grow;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And I with my long nails will dig thee pignuts;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Show thee a jay's nest and instruct thee how

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: To snare the nimble marmoset; I'll bring thee

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: To clustering filberts and sometimes I'll get thee

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Young scamels from the rock. Wilt thou go with me?

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: I prithee now, lead the way without any more

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: talking. Trinculo, the king and all our company

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: else being drowned, we will inherit here: here;

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: bear my bottle: fellow Trinculo, we'll fill him by

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: and by again.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: [Sings drunkenly]

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Farewell master; farewell, farewell!

speaker: TRINCULO
text_entry: A howling monster: a drunken monster!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: No more dams I'll make for fish

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Nor fetch in firing

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: At requiring;

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Nor scrape trencher, nor wash dish

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: 'Ban, 'Ban, Cacaliban

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Has a new master: get a new man.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Freedom, hey-day! hey-day, freedom! freedom,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: hey-day, freedom!

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: O brave monster! Lead the way.

speaker: STEPHANO
text_entry: Exeunt
